22.m: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places - Ephesians 1:3 (ESV)

l.q: What are some of the spiritual blessings God has given us as saints in Christ?
l.a: God has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places. He made us holy and blameless before Him, He adopted us as sons through Christ, He redeemed us and forgave us of our sins. We have an inheritance from God and we were sealed with the Holy Spirit.

l.q: What is Paul's prayer to the saints in Ephesus in verses 15-20?
l.a: Paul was praying that God may give the saints the Spirit of wisdom and of revelation of Christ. That their eyes and hearts will be enlightened. That they may know their hope in Christ. That they may know the immeasurable greatness of God's power towards those who believe.

l.q: What do verses 20-23 tell us about Christ?
l.a: Verses 20-23 tell us that Christ was raised from the dead and is seated at the right hand of God. Christ is above all rule and authority and power and dominion and every name not only in this age but in the age to come. That all things are under His feet and He is the head over all things. That the church is His body.

22.p: Heavenly Father, the pain and the sufferings that you allow me to go through here on earth is nothing compared to all the blessings that I have from you, all because of your grace through Jesus Christ. I did not do anything to receive all these but to repent of my sins and believe in Christ. Even the trials from you are meant to strengthen my faith in you and all the more make me like Christ. Thank you for the hope and the Holy Spirit in me.
